 Thursday, July 6, 2023 9:44 PM
To:

m.neu@lcwmail.com

b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Bonus Payout -BD Team
 
Hi Melissa – thank you for sending this over. There are a few questions I have here for the team –
 
The Ad Council proposal date was in 2022, the SOW issue date was in March, and the signed SOW date was 6/8. Should this be eligible for the commission since the proposal and SOW issue date was pre-BD Bonus Structure which started in Q2? It doesn’t qualify for the proposal bonus.  
 
If this commission structure remains, this will need to be clarified and put in writing for Pedro. We were told SOW signature (not for counting towards a proposal creation, but for the percentage of the sale). An SOW is just a proposal until signed, and Hannah is responsible for this sale. We sent the attached, and then it was transitioned to Tamara, who received the signed SOW in June. 
What are we paying them for? If it is for proposal then this one seems to exist outside of the agreed timeframe. If it is for SOW signature then it seems to fall well within the timeframe for counting it. Am I missing something else here?
Ulteig is closed won. I don’t see this quote in Compas. 
@Melissa Neu
, can you confirm? 
There was confusion with the consultant about whether the attached signed proposal is the same as a SOW. I’ve confirmed with Andrea and discussed with Chuck that she will still need to create an SOW; it doesn’t look like she has done so yet. However, per the attached, the client has committed and signed. 
Should Hannah be paid for the proposals sent after her departure date? (UL LLC, Bright Horizons, nVent, Hopechicago) If not, then the number of proposals for her is 33 (also excluding The Ad Council), which is one short of qualifying for the bonus of 34 total proposals sent for the QTR to qualify. 
Hannah worked on Bright Horizons and HopeChicago.  Hannah helped build the HopeChicago proposal, but I presented it to the client after she left. Also, the date isn’t accurate for UL, LLC.in HubSpot. The deal was created well after the original proposal was sent on 5/9. I’ll get HubSpot fixed, and I’m attaching the proposal for your records.
 
If she was instrumental in getting these in front of the prospect I would reward them to her. It sounds like she was, but the proposals weren’t sent until after she left. As long as we aren’t double paying for these we were going to pay someone, correct?
 
Thank you,
Jennifer

From:
 Melissa Neu <
m.neu@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, June 28, 2023 11:23 PM
To:
 Jennifer Barbieri <
j.barbieri@lcwmail.com

b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Bonus Payout -BD Team
 
Hi Jennifer,
 
Thank you for combing through the report and for your insights. Your efforts helped me to review the accuracy of the data as it is being pulled from HubSpot. The report feature I used was not entirely accurate, so I’ve updated the attached report for you today and worked on troubleshooting the issue. The attached has removed any proposals in progress and Deb’s pursuits that we were not involved in. Moog is The only existing client I have record of building a proposal for this quarter.
 
Tracking proposals sent by the date is tricky for a few reasons, including that there is no HubSpot reporting feature to pull a deal status change date. Since we don’t only create proposals only in HubSpot and often make proposals that other individual emails to the prospect, this information is typically tracked via email correspondence and notes, I will need to work with Pedro to create a new process that makes the data that you can pull more accurate. 
 
One immediate change is that I’ve created multiple workflows to log the date a deal status is changed to Proposal Sent, Negotiation, and Passed to Consultant. This change will allow folks to quickly look at the left sidebar to see the dates and allow the team to pull a report with the data going forward. Keep in mind it can’t work retroactively; however, it will help Pedro to report progress to you in Q3.
 
 
 
I will work with Pedro to ensure that any changes to the attached are captured in HubSpot by EOB Friday, and I will provide you with a final report at that time.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa
 
 
C. Melissa Neu
Business Development Manager
+1 (773) 389-5168

Hi Melissa – I’m reviewing this now and have some questions and comments. Let’s discuss the following:
 
According to Hubspot, I see 2 more accounts that Deb is handling (Women Lift Health and Upwardly Global) to make a total of 4. If we exclude all of Deb’s accounts with the exception of Pfizer per your note, the total number of accounts are now 32 which is less than the 34 minimum to qualify for the bonus
I added in a column for Date Proposal Sent. There are some accounts which do not have a proposal attachment in Hubspot and I don’t know when the proposal was actually sent. Please fill in the missing information so we can evaluate these accounts
The bonus specifically states proposals sent. I don’t think we should be including the proposal in progress stage. There are 3 here on the list 
@Alisa Kolodizner
 and 
@Chuck Adams
 please weigh in here
Commissions are based on executed SOWs so the only account eligible to be paid out commissions on is Insight. SOWs signature pending should not 
@Alisa Kolodizner
 and 
@Chuck Adams
 please weigh in here
 
Happy to discuss further and answer any questions you may have.
 
Thank you,
Jennifer

 Re: Bonus Payout -BD Team
 
Hi Melissa - thank you for sharing. Please provide the list of proposals sent by client that match the matrix sent below. 
 
Thank you,
Jennifer 
Sent from my iPhone
 
On Jun 16, 2023, at 3:34 PM, Melissa Neu <
m.neu@lcwmail.com
> wrote:
﻿ 
Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa
 
C. Melissa Neu
Business Development Manager
+1 (773) 389-5168

subject: August Birthdays/Anniversaries
body:
Hi Jennifer,
Language & Culture Worldwide has some celebrating to do in August!
Anniversaries
Sarah Nodarse: Tue, Aug 01 -- 4 years working for the company 
Ashton Vicente: Thu, Aug 03 -- 1 year working for the company 
Birthdays
Conner Williams: Thu, Aug 03
Andrea Wicks Bowles: Thu, Aug 10
Tamara Thorpe: Mon, Aug 21
How do I get reminders for these events?

Hi Jennifer,
 
Thank you for combing through the report and for your insights. Your efforts helped me to review the accuracy of the data as it is being pulled from HubSpot. The report feature I used was not entirely accurate, so I’ve updated the attached report for you today and worked on troubleshooting the issue. The attached has removed any proposals in progress and Deb’s pursuits that we were not involved in. Moog is The only existing client I have record of building a proposal for this quarter.
 
Tracking proposals sent by the date is tricky for a few reasons, including that there is no HubSpot reporting feature to pull a deal status change date. Since we don’t only create proposals only in HubSpot and often make proposals that other individual emails to the prospect, this information is typically tracked via email correspondence and notes, I will need to work with Pedro to create a new process that makes the data that you can pull more accurate. 
 
One immediate change is that I’ve created multiple workflows to log the date a deal status is changed to Proposal Sent, Negotiation, and Passed to Consultant. This change will allow folks to quickly look at the left sidebar to see the dates and allow the team to pull a report with the data going forward. Keep in mind it can’t work retroactively; however, it will help Pedro to report progress to you in Q3.
 
 
 
I will work with Pedro to ensure that any changes to the attached are captured in HubSpot by EOB Friday, and I will provide you with a final report at that time.
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa

﻿ 
Dear Chuck & Maria,
 
As we discussed in our meeting on Wednesday, I’m writing to remind you all about the bonus commission plan presented to our team on 4/28/23 by Jennifer and Alisa that went into effect on April 1.   While my team did not receive formal documentation through Zenefits, I am attaching screenshots of what was presented along with the notes outlined below. Jeniffer previously shared calculations in spreadsheet format; however, I do not have a copy of the most recent version. Nevertheless, here I am attaching a copy of an early version, and I include a summary of both what was told to the team and the current status of proposals:
 
Summary of Bonus Structure Plan:
 
Proposal Production
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on proposal production.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
The BD team’s targeted number of proposals is 180/per year
The BD has a quarterly proposal production target of 45 per quarter.
If the BD team collectively meets 75% of their goal of 45 per quarter (34 proposals), they are eligible for a bonus payout on the proposals created
The bonus Structure is as follows:
 
Client Type
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Associate)
Proposal Pay Out per proposal per quarter if 75% of the quarterly goal is met (BD Manager)
New Client
$50
$100
Dormant Client
$25
$50
Existing Client
$12.50
$25
 
Percentages of SOW’s Signed
BD Proposal team will be eligible for quarterly bonuses based on SOWs passed to the consultant from BD and signed by the client.
Quarterly Bonus Payout will be paid one month after the quarter ends
BD Associates are eligible for a .25% commission on the total of executed SOWs; BD Manager is eligible for a .50% commission on the sum of executed SOWs
 
Quarter Two Summary – BD Team Only (Melissa, Hannah, Pedro) – 4/1/23 – 6/16/23
 
New Client
32 Proposals
Dormant Client
 
Existing Client
2 Proposals
Total
34 Proposals
Proposals in Progress (New Clients)
2 Proposals
 
 
SOWs Signature Pending
$117,569
SOWs Executed
$8,500
 
 
 
Given that Hannah’s last day is today, I want to ensure you have this information to include in the calculations of the pay owed to her. Please let me know if you have any questions or need additional information. I will provide updated numbers on June 30, 2023.
 
Kind regards,
 
Melissa
